Los Gigantes is well connected by roads (and the TITSA public transport system), and the easiest way to get in is either by
) or by sailing into the resort's marina.

The best way to get around the resort of Los Gigantes is by foot, however, if you wish to get up or down from Puerto Santiago it is advisable to get a taxi, which are reasonably priced, due to the steep hills.

Los Gigantes has notable cliffs in view of the resort and a picturesque marina.

The nearby village of
is very traditional, but can take an hour to drive to, due to the shapes of the roads and the fact it is on the otherside of the cliffs. Parking in this village is
limited and it may take a while to find a space.

Many excursions are run from Los Gigantes for things such as whale watching.

It is also worth going to
, which is some distance away in
on the other side of the island. It has many kosher restaurants
There are a number of restaurants along the marina and in the village centre. CK's Bistro, in the village, serves English cuisine.
There are a number of bars.

value: content=The Tajinaste Clubhouse is a fantastic place 5 minutes out of Los Gigantes. Its is set in beautiful surroundings with stunning panoramic views of Los Gigantes and La Gomera. As a Live music venue it boasts a wide range of live music to suit all ages with their set days of entertainment. Fantastic food is available in the evening including a char grill menu from the magnificent barbecue,and tapas is served throughout the day.
